009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.nonlinear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.mask.CircularMask;
014import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
015import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
016import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
017
018/**
019 * Basic vector median filter for color images implemented
020 * by extending the {@link GenericFilterVector} class.
021 * 
022 * @author W. Burger
023 * @version 2020/12/31
024 * @version 2022/09/10 removed debugging code
025 */
026public class VectorMedianFilter extends GenericFilterVector {
027        
028        public static class Parameters extends ScalarMedianFilter.Parameters {
029                /** Distance norm to use */
030                public NormType distanceNorm = NormType.L1;     
031        }
032        
033        private final CircularMask mask;
034        private final int maskCount;
035        private final byte[][] maskArray;
036        private final int xc, yc;
037        private final float[][] supportRegion;          // supportRegion[i][c] with index i, color component c
038        private final VectorNorm vNorm;
039        private final float[] vals = new float[3];      // check, adapt to depth
040        
041        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
042        
043        public VectorMedianFilter() {   
044                this(new Parameters());
045        }
046        
047        public VectorMedianFilter(Parameters params) {
048                this.mask = new CircularMask(params.radius);
049                this.maskCount = mask.getElementCount();
050                this.maskArray = mask.getByteArray();
051                this.xc = mask.getCenterX();
052                this.yc = mask.getCenterY();
053                this.supportRegion = new float[maskCount][3];
054                this.vNorm = params.distanceNorm.getInstance();
055        }
056        
057        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
058        
059        @Override
060        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
061                final float[] pCtr = pack.getPix(u, v);
062                getSupportRegion(pack, u, v);
063                double dCtr = aggregateDistance(pCtr); 
064                double dMin = Double.MAX_VALUE;
065                int jMin = -1;
066                for (int j = 0; j < supportRegion.length; j++) {
067                        float[] p = supportRegion[j];
068                        double d = aggregateDistance(p);
069                        if (d < dMin) {
070                                jMin = j;
071                                dMin = d;
072                        }
073                }
074                float[] pmin = supportRegion[jMin];
075                // modify this pixel only if the min aggregate distance of some
076                // other pixel in the filter region is smaller
077                // than the aggregate distance of the original center pixel:
078                final float[] pF = new float[3];        // the returned color tupel
079                if (dMin < dCtr) {      // modify this pixel
080                        copyPixel(pmin, pF);
081                }
082                else {  // keep the original pixel value
083                        copyPixel(pCtr, pF);
084                }
085                return pF;
086        }
087        
088        private void getSupportRegion(PixelPack src, int u, int v) {
089                // fill 'supportRegion' for current mask position
090                int k = 0;
091                for (int i = 0; i < maskArray.length; i++) {
092                        int ui = u + i - xc;
093                        for (int j = 0; j < maskArray[0].length; j++) {
094                                if (maskArray[i][j] != 0) {
095                                        int vj = v + j - yc;
096                                        src.getPix(ui, vj, vals);
097                                        copyPixel(vals, supportRegion[k]);
098                                        k = k + 1;
099                                }
100                        }
101                }
102        }
103        
104        // find the color with the smallest summed distance to all others.
105        // brute force and thus slow
106        private double aggregateDistance(float[] p) {
107                double d = 0;
108                for (int i = 0; i < supportRegion.length; i++) {
109                        d = d + vNorm.distance(p, supportRegion[i]);
110                }
111                return d;
112        }
113}
